Class EventDetailController

java.lang.Object
com.lucas.ticketsalesmanager.views.controllers.scenes.EventDetailController
public class EventDetailController extends Object
Controller responsible for managing the event detail screen. This screen has different behavior for administrators and regular users.
  • Admins can create and edit events, set available seats, and update event information.
  • Users can reserve seats, leave feedback, and view event details.
The controller interacts with the EventController to manage event data and updates the user interface accordingly.

  • Constructor Details

    • EventDetailController

      public EventDetailController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller by setting up the user and configuring the view based on the user's role (Admin or Regular User).

    • setEventAndUser

      public void setEventAndUser(Event event)
      Sets the current event and user information.
      Parameters:
      event - The event whose details will be displayed.

    • handleReserveSeat

      public void handleReserveSeat()
      Handles the reservation of a seat. Users can select a seat from the list and confirm the reservation. Admins can set the number of available seats for an event.

    • getReservedEvent

      public Event getReservedEvent()
      Gets the reserved event after a seat reservation is completed.
      Returns:
      The reserved event.

    • getReservedSeat

      public String getReservedSeat()
      Gets the reserved seat identifier after a seat reservation is completed.
      Returns:
      The reserved seat identifier.

    • handleSaveEvent

      public void handleSaveEvent()
      Handles the action of saving a new event or updating an existing one. Admins can create a new event or update the details of an existing event.

    • handleSaveFeedback

      public void handleSaveFeedback()
      Handles the action of saving user feedback for the current event. Users can rate the event and leave a comment.

    • handleCancelFeedback

      public void handleCancelFeedback()
      Handles the action of canceling the feedback form. If the form has been partially filled, it asks for confirmation before clearing it.
